III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Agency was provided with technical assistance relative to timely submission of
updated service plans. It was assessed that the monitoring tool used by the
agency was calculating due dates incorrectly, thus resulting in all updated
service plans submitted during this reporting period being one day late.
Adjustments have been made, and agency is confident that monitoring tool will
produce accurate due dates.

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not require or request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were 1 substantiated incident of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period. This was within investigation report 2025SIC0000096 dated 01/24/2025
which found the facility in non-compliance of providing adequate supervision and
failing to immediately report suspected abuse and/or neglect. A corrective action
plan dated 03/08/2025 was approved that included three staff being terminated,
revision of staff guidelines and training for all staff to reiterate staff supervision
expectations.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 4 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special Investigation 2025SIC0000096 with CAP approval date of 03/08/2025
was the result of a violation for lack of supervision by staff and failure to
immediately report suspected abuse and/or neglect. The agency updated policy
and provided training to staff. The agency is currently complying with the CAP
action steps, and DCWL continues to monitor CAP compliance with no noted
concerns.
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001696 with CAP approval date of 10/31/2024
was the result of a violation for use of seclusion and a staff pushing a youth. The
agency provided training to staff, and it also resulted in staff termination. The
agency is currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to
monitor CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001405 with CAP approval date of 07/15/2024
was the result of a violation for use of unapproved restraint techniques. The
agency reviewed protocol with staff and staff involved was terminated. The
agency is currently complying with the CAP action steps, and DCWL continues to
monitor CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Special Investigation 2024SIC0001319 with CAP approval date of 07/15/2024
was the result of a violation for use of seclusion. The agency provided training to
staff and engaged staff in monthly coaching with administration for overall
improvement. The agency is currently complying with the CAP action steps, and
DCWL continues to monitor CAP compliance with no noted concerns.

Financial Overview
There were no financial concerns identified in the annual audit reviewed.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed. Chief administrator reported
since the last reporting period, the agency has continued to work on increasing
staffing and improved training of staff. The agency continues to utilize CPI
behavior management model and are providing training to staff annually and
refreshers as required or deemed necessary. For the next coming year, the facility
will continue to focus in the areas of sufficiency and training of staff, safe milieu
management and a decrease in the use of physical restraint with agency
population.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Four staff were interviewed during the onsite visit for the interim review. No issues
or concerns were noted. Staff spoke positively about employment with agency.
Three youth were interviewed during the onsite visit for interim review. Youth
advised that they feel comfortable expressing any concerns with consultant and
staff. They report needs are being met and each could identify a benefit of the
program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the agency was completed. No concerns were noted, and the
agency was found to be well maintained.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
